function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Retailers sourcing from a wider geographic region may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases through the distribution chain.","Impact":"Increased spread of contagious diseases, potential for wider outbreaks and public health crises.","Mitigation":"Implement strict health and safety protocols for suppliers and systems.","People":"Suppliers, employees, and consumers in the distribution chain.","Owner":"Retailers, suppliers, and regulatory authorities."},{"Description":"Operating 24/7 and providing retail services whenever and wherever the consumer demands may increase the risk of transmission of contagious diseases due to higher foot traffic and frequent interactions.","Impact":"Higher likelihood of systems.","People":"Employees, customers, and the general public.","Owner":"Retailers, local health authorities, and facility management."},{"Description":"Inadequate replenishment of goods during the management systems, establish emergency restocking protocols, and collaborate with multiple suppliers for resilience.","Technologies":"Inventory tracking software, supply chain management systems, and predictive analytics for demand forecasting.","People":"Retailers, consumers, and public health authorities.","Owner":"Retailers, supply chain managers, and industry regulators."}]}
